title: Playing League on Ultrawide Displays?
body: I was considering getting an ultrawide display... how does league run on it? Can I see any pics of examples?

replies.body: You might run into issues if your display is 4K or exceeds 1920x1080.  It's not officially supported so you might run into issues, though it may be possible to reduce the scaling.  Let me know if that clears things up!

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Qz7QQykk,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-05-31T23:34:17.762+0000)

Thanks for the quick response. I have a 1440p monitor currently. I doubt I will upgrade soon since this monitor is expensive and I can't afford nor do I need another. (Nvidia please lower the cost of G-Sync!!!)

I just saw an awesome looking monitor at Computex 2017 over [here](https://rog.asus.com/articles/gaming-monitors/the-35-rog-swift-pg35vq-gaming-monitor-turns-hdr-and-quantum-dots-up-to-200hz/) and it made me wonder about League since some YouTube videos of it mention e-sports (since the back of the monitor has RGB lighting for supposedly e-sports crowds?).
